1.name: Phase 1: Market Fit & Strategy
1.description: Define the critical pain points, unique value proposition, and competitive advantage of EG's construction AI solution.
1.contributors: VP of Quality Control, Site Supervisors, Safety Directors, CFO

questions.text: What specific pain point are we solving that the customer cannot efficiently address today?
questions.criteria: Identification of field expertise gap, impact of delayed defect detection, failure of manual inspections, financial/safety risk specificity
questions.focus: Identify specific manual inspection failures and expertise gap financial impacts.
questions.hint_text: Describe the inability of field workers to diagnose defects instantly and the shortage of qualified inspectors. Mention how manual walkthroughs are periodic and miss critical anomalies that lead to expensive rework.
questions.ideal_answer: Construction teams suffer from a massive expertise gap where workers discover anomalies but cannot diagnose them instantly. Today, they rely on periodic manual inspections by scarce experts, leading to defects being caught too late—when they've already caused structural damage or safety hazards. This results in millions in rework costs, project delays, and liability risks that manual, paper-based, or legacy digital checklists simply cannot prevent.

questions.text: What measurable value will the customer realize, and how quickly?
questions.criteria: Quantifiable rework cost reduction, time savings for site supervisors, ROI timeline clarity (days/weeks), safety incident reduction
questions.focus: Quantify immediate site rework savings and project ROI timeline speed.
questions.hint_text: Focus on immediate value like reduced remediation costs and faster inspection cycles. Mention how quickly a project can see ROI—often within the first few weeks of deployment.
questions.ideal_answer: Customers realize immediate value through a 40% reduction in rework costs and 60% faster inspection cycles. Within 30 days of deployment, site teams can identify and resolve 95% of visual defects on-site without waiting for external experts, preventing budget overruns and ensuring project timelines are met. The ROI is often achieved by preventing a single major structural failure.

questions.text: Why is EG the right partner? What differentiates EG?
questions.criteria: Proprietary defect dataset, ease of use for field frontline, seamless project management integration, domain-specific AI accuracy
questions.focus: Highlight proprietary defect accuracy against generic AI model limitations specifically.
questions.hint_text: Highlight our unique library of 1M+ construction defect images and our 'field-first' design that requires zero training for workers. Contrast this with generic AI models.
questions.ideal_answer: EG stands apart due to our proprietary database of 1M+ construction-specific defect images, enabling 99.8% diagnostic accuracy that generic AI cannot match. Our solution is designed for the field, not the office—requiring zero training for workers and integrating directly with Procore and PlanGrid. We aren't just an AI company; we are construction experts who understand the realities of a job site.

2.name: Phase 2: Product & Experience
2.description: Detail the integration, user journey, and trust mechanisms that ensure user adoption and confidence.
2.contributors: VP of Technology, Quality Control Directors, Field Operations Managers

questions.text: How does the solution integrate into their existing workflows and systems?
questions.criteria: Integration with PM tools (Procore/PlanGrid), API connectivity, offline capability, data ingestion process
questions.focus: Detail seamless Procore ticket creation and offline field data synchronization.
questions.hint_text: Explain how a photo taken in our app automatically creates a ticket in their existing PM system. Mention offline mode for remote sites with poor connectivity.
questions.ideal_answer: Our solution integrates seamlessly via native plugins for Procore and PlanGrid. A field worker captures a photo, and our AI instantly creates a tagged defect ticket with severity ratings and remediation steps directly in their existing daily logs. Plus, our edge-AI works completely offline, syncing data only when the worker returns to a Wi-Fi zone, ensuring zero disruption to field workflows.

questions.text: What does the user experience look like for different stakeholders or personas at the customer?
questions.criteria: Field worker simplicity, Manager dashboard visibility, Executive reporting clarity, role-specific value mapping
questions.focus: Compare simple worker mobile interface with executive risk heatmap dashboards.
questions.hint_text: Describe the 'point-and-click' experience for workers vs. the 'risk-heatmap' view for quality managers and the 'ROI dashboard' for executives.
questions.ideal_answer: For workers, it's a simple 'point-and-click' mobile experience providing instant guidance. Quality Managers see a real-time risk heatmap across all project sites, allowing them to redirect resources to high-risk areas. Executives receive automated weekly reports quantifying the rework costs avoided and project health metrics, providing total visibility into organizational quality standards.

questions.text: What safeguards and controls give them confidence in the AI's outputs?
questions.criteria: Confidence scores, human-in-the-loop triggers, explainable AI (visual highlights), data security, verification loops
questions.focus: Explain explainable AI pattern highlighting and human expert verification loops.
questions.hint_text: Highlight how the AI 'shows its work' by highlighting specific defect patterns and how low-confidence results are automatically escalated to human engineers.
questions.ideal_answer: We build trust through 'Explainable AI'—our system highlights the exact visual patterns it used for diagnosis. Every result comes with a confidence score; any diagnosis below 90% is automatically flagged for human-in-the-loop review by an EG engineer. All data is encrypted at rest and in transit, ensuring project proprietary information never leaves the customer's secure environment.

3.name: Phase 3: Execution & Scale
3.description: Outline the roadmap for success, evidence of performance, and the support model for organizational-wide rollout.
3.contributors: CEO, Quality Control Directors, Site Operations Leaders, Safety Managers

questions.text: What does success look like at 90 days, 6 months, and 12 months?
questions.criteria: 90-day pilot validation, 6-month site-wide adoption, 12-month company-wide standard, specific KPI milestones
questions.focus: Map 90-day pilot milestones toward enterprise-wide quality management standardization.
questions.hint_text: Define milestones from verifying accuracy in a single pilot (90 days) to becoming the company-wide standard for quality (12 months).
questions.ideal_answer: At 90 days, success is completing a pilot on one major site with 95% worker adoption and verifiable rework reduction. At 6 months, we scale to all regional projects, integrating fully with corporate reporting. By 12 months, EG becomes the organization-wide standard for quality assurance, with a measurable 30% reduction in total cost of quality across the entire enterprise.

questions.text: What evidence do we have that this works for companies like them?
questions.criteria: Case study references, project size/type similarity, benchmark metrics, third-party validations
questions.focus: Reference ENR contractor results and third-party structural audit validations.
questions.hint_text: Mention our success with Top 100 ENR contractors and specific results like the 25% margin improvement seen on recent high-rise projects.
questions.ideal_answer: We have successfully deployed with three 'Top 100 ENR' contractors. On a recent $500M high-rise project, our solution identified 45 critical waterproofing defects that manual inspections missed, saving the client an estimated $1.2M in future remediation and improving project margins by 15%. Our benchmarks are validated by independent structural engineering audits.

questions.text: How will we support them through adoption and scale?
questions.criteria: Customer Success Manager (CSM) role, field training programs, technical support SLAs, monthly business reviews (MBRs)
questions.focus: Outline dedicated Customer Success roles and field-first training program implementation.
questions.hint_text: Detail our dedicated field support teams who go on-site for trainer-the-trainer sessions and our 24/7 technical hotline.
questions.ideal_answer: We provide a dedicated Customer Success Manager to oversee the rollout. Our 'Field-First' support includes on-site train-the-trainer sessions and 24/7 technical assistance. We conduct Monthly Business Reviews to track KPI performance and optimize the AI models based on site-specific feedback, ensuring the solution scales smoothly from one site to one hundred.
